result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:29 AM Defendant Timothy S. Hegwood in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Timothy S. Hegwood.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2). Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit. To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days. Attorney Griffis is asking for Melissa Westendorf to be the examiner. The Court will set this matter before the Trial Court for a review on competency. Bail remains as fixed.
Review hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
